intro: Eriospermum asarifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf eriosperm, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to the western United States, particularly California, and thrives in dry, rocky habitats. Eriospermum asarifolium is often found in open woodlands and chaparral, where it contributes to the local biodiversity.
